oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bonnie Scotland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bonnie Scotland was born in England in 1853. He won the Doncaster Stakes and Liverpool St. Leger. He was purchased by Gen. William G. Harding to be a stud at Belle Meade in 1872. In 1880, he was named outstanding sire of the year. Many of his descendants won notable races including the Kentucky Derby.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Troye, Edward, 1808-1874
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Thoroughbred horse; Thoroughbred horse--Breeding; Thoroughbred horse--Pedigrees; Thoroughbred horse--Breeding--United States--History
Horses; Race horses
